dataset_id: BOREAS TE-09 in situ Understory Spectral Reflectance within the NSA
title: BOREAS TE-09 in situ Understory Spectral Reflectance within the NSA
summary: Contains forest understory spectral reflectance data collected by BOREAS TE-09 at the ground level in the Old Jack Pine, Young Jack Pine nd Young Aspen boreal forest sites in the NSA.

cmr.title: BOREAS TE-09 in situ Understory Spectral Reflectance within the NSA
cmr.summary: Contains forest understory spectral reflectance data collected by BOREAS TE-09 at the ground level in the Old Jack Pine, Young Jack Pine nd Young Aspen boreal forest sites in the NSA.
cmr.description: Contains forest understory spectral reflectance data collected by BOREAS TE-09 at the ground level in the Old Jack Pine, Young Jack Pine nd Young Aspen boreal forest sites in the NSA.

citation: Bye, I.J., P.R.J. North, S.O. Los, N. Kljun, J.A.B. Rosette, C. Hopkinson, L. Chasmer, and C. Mahoney. 2017. Estimating forest canopy parameters from satellite waveform LiDAR by inversion of the FLIGHT three-dimensional radiative transfer model. Remote Sensing of Environment. 188:177-189.

Dawson, T.P. 2010. The potential for estimating chlorophyll content from a vegetation canopy using the Medium Resolution Imaging Spectrometer (MERIS). International Journal of Remote Sensing. 21(10):2043-2051.

Dawson, T.P., P.R.J. North, S.E. Plummer, and P.J. Curran. 2010. Forest ecosystem chlorophyll content: Implications for remotely sensed estimates of net primary productivity. International Journal of Remote Sensing. 24(3):611-617.
